body.p: To His Excellency B MaGoffin Govr of Kentucky
Your Petitioner Gabriel Weitzell States that at the Feby term 1861 of the Franklin Circuit Court he was fined $50 for letting C. G. Grahams negro have liquor

He states that the said Graham gave him a general order to let his Grahams Slaves have liquor at any time; which is herewith presented. The only condition of which is that they should have "good liquor" This order was deemed insufficient but Your Petitioner let Said Slave have it in good faith honestly believing that the law permitted it He prays for the remission of said fine.

We Concur in the prayer of this Petition
Jno Rodman
Tho. C. Kyle
Thos. J. Frazier
John O Connell
J, W, Southe
C S. Kahr

Franklin Cir. Ct
G Weitzells
Petn to Govr
Respite 12 mo
B. M
$50 } liquor to a slave
Gabl. Weitzell
Issd Apr 17 1861
